TJ.note:
n 1993, a Chinese military delegation, headed by the commander of the Lanzhou Military Region in northwestern China, visited Tajikistan, offering a "gift" of 5 million yuan. By 2004, the total sum of Chinese grants had approached $20 million.

https://carnegieendowment.org/2022/12/07/how-china-s-foreign-aid-fosters-social-bonds-with-central-asian-ruling-elites-pub-88579

PE.evidence: Retired Admiral Gonzalo Ríos Polastri is the current deputy general director of Cosco Shipping Ports Chancay Perú. It should be noted that Cosco is the Chinese company in charge of the construction of the Chancay Megaport, Lima. Therefore, this indicator deserves a “Yes” response.
PE.note: Retired Admiral Gonzalo Ríos Polastri began working for Cosco as soon as he left the Vice Minister of Resources for the Defense of the Ministry of Defense of Peru, in October 2019. This according to his personal Linkedin profile.
PE.answerer: Answered by Jack Lo Lau and Jorge Jesús Chávez Ortíz, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

GR.evidence: Although there are no reported cases of Greek retired or active military or intelligence officers receiving direct or deferred benefits from PRC-connected individuals or entities, there are reports that China is recruiting former NATO-member military officers, like combat pilots, throught companies likned to the PLA (example: Test Flying Academy of South Africa - TFASA). Given the fact that Greece is a NATO country, it would not be unlikely for its military personnel to have been targeted by China via similar methods Therefore, a definite answer to this Indicator cannot be provided.
GR.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

PK.evidence: Not enough info available to substantiate this. The army effectively leads Pakistan's strategic ties with PRC. The deals and negotiations are often secretive and not subject to parliamentary or media scrutiny. Pakistani generals are known to have enriched themselves. Given the strategic alliance and growing dependence on China, it would not be surprising if serving and retired commanders have received personal benefits and rewards from the PRC or its entities. However, in the absence of proof, this would be a speculation.
PK.answerer: Answered by Shahzeb Jillani, and has been reviewed by Shahzada Zulfiqar

AF.evidence: So far, no such news or information has been revealed.

SG.evidence: There is one person who clearly fits this description who is publicly known at this point--George Yeo, who is a retired general and a former foreign minister. He formerly worked for the Kerry Group/Kuok group. However, senior officers from Singapore are not well-known and the identities of intelligence officials tend not to be public. Tracking their post-retirement activities are more challenging as a result.
SG.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

TW.evidence: There have been multiple cases of retired and incubent militery personnels being recruited to spy for PRC. In Octber 2023, colonel Liu Sheng-shu was sentenced to 20 years for running a military spy ring for China, while the 5 other officers being sentenced to 6 months to 20 years. In November 2023, 10 people including active-duty and retired military personnel were indicted on suspicion of spying for China in Taoyuan. Meanwhile in Kaohsiung, three other pesonnels were indicted under the National Security Law.
TW.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

BR.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

CZ.evidence: During the President Zeman`s era of the “restart” of the Czech-Chinese relations, Jaroslav Tvrdík, a former Minister of Defense and lieutenant colonel was holding several positions in the CEFC company, and he was also the president of the Czech China Chamber of Collaboration.
CZ.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

ID.evidence: There are generals in Indonesia who directly benefit from having their businesses suspended by entities linked to China either openly or secretly while still in office.
ID.answerer: Answered by Muhammad Zulfikar Rakhmat, and has been reviewed by Yeta Purnama

KR.evidence:
In July 2015, a naval officer belonging to the Armed Forces Security Command (currently the Military Security Support Command) was arrested and indicted on charges of leaking military secrets to China. According to the 2016 Supreme Court ruling (2016Do11677 decision), the materials handed over by this naval officer included THAAD-related materials. 

According to the prosecution's indictment, this naval officer received the data from another officer who had the data under the pretext of using it for educational and research purposes, then took pictures and handed them over to the Chinese (the court ruled that this was an attempt). He even provided Chinese explanations by hand.
KR.answerer: Answered by Muhammad Zulfikar Rakhmat, and has been reviewed by Yeta Purnama

SA.evidence: Chinese State Councilor and Minister of National Defense Wei Fenghe held talks via video link with Saudi Arabia's Deputy Defense Minister Khalid bin Salman on January 26, 2022.
SA.answerer: Answered by Muhammad Zulfikar Rakhmat, and has been reviewed by Yeta Purnama
